page.title: 04Frogmore Nature Reserve
page.content: In Chalgrove we have a big field, we call it Frogmore. Archeologists found a medieval manor site there;now that has been covered by a football pitch. The rest of the field has been made into a nature reserve. We have made camps out of wood and mats also we climb the trees that grow all round. We have set mouse traps because we want to study mice. Starlings, blackbirds, thrushes, blue tits, coal-tits and mallard have nested there; many more types of bird feed and visit. A pond was dug this year, but the water does not stay in it, we hope to line it with clay to make it water- tight. Then it will be a safe home for the frogs, newts and toads that also live in the surrounding ditches.
